citation.article-title: Fontibacillus aquaticus gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a warm spring
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Fontibacillus (Fon.ti.ba.cil′lus. L. masc. n. fons fontis a spring, fountain; L. masc. n. bacillus a bacillus/rod; N.L. masc. n. Fontibacillus a rod-shaped bacterium isolated from a spring).
Cells are rod-shaped, show a Gram-positive reaction in the aminopeptidase test, are facultatively anaerobic and spore-forming.
Endospores are ellipsoidal, terminal or subterminal in bulging sporangia.
Predominant polar lipids are PG, DPG, PE and moderate amounts of APGL; an aminophospholipid (PN2) and an unknown lipid (UL6) are also present.
Major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
Fatty acids C14 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0 occur in moderate amounts.
The type species is Fontibacillus aquaticus.
